material.mattext: Which of the following actions will redisplay Web form fields with their default values?
Resetting the form
Submitting the form
Processing the form
E-mailing the form
Which of the following actions will upload user data from a Web form to the receiving server?
Submitting the form
Processing the form
Resetting the form
Storing the form
What is the term for code embedded into an HTML page and downloaded by a user to help process Web form input?
Client-side script
Server-side script
Common Gateway Interface (CGI)
Structured Query Language (SQL)
When you submit a Web form, the browser sends the information entered in this form to the Web server as:
a raw text string.
a client-side script.
a server-side script.
hexadecimal code.
Which <input> tag attribute organizes Web form information submitted by the user into the basic elements for a raw text string, which is then processed by the Web server?
The name attribute
The action attribute
The method attribute
The type attribute
In a raw text string, which of the following is used to delimit name=value pairs?
Ampersands ( & )
Pipe symbols ( | )
Plus signs ( + )
Quotation marks ( " " )
In a raw text string, which of the following is used to replace spaces entered by the user?
Plus signs ( + )
Ampersands ( & )
Underscores ( _ )
Quotation marks ( " " )
Which <form> tag attribute uses the "get" and "post" values to specify how the browser will send form data to a Web server?
The method attribute
The action attribute
The name attribute
The type attribute
Which <form> tag attribute specifies the process required to send form data to a Web server?
The method attribute
The action attribute
The name attribute
The type attribute
When creating Web forms, you use the <input> tag to
create text boxes, check boxes, radio buttons, and the Submit and Reset buttons.
create form fields into which the user can enter multiple lines of text.
create single-option and multiple-option lists from which the user can choose items.
create a form into which you can input various form fields.
When using the <input> tag, you designate the form field type by assigning the appropriate value to:
the type attribute.
the name attribute.
the select attribute.
the textarea attribute.
You are creating a select list for your Web form. You want to allow users to choose more than one response from your list. Which attribute and value should you add to the <select> tag to allow this?
multiple="multiple"
type="multiple"
value="multiple"
multiple="yes"
When creating a Web form, which tag should you use to create a list from which users can choose one or more options?
The <select> tag
The <form> tag
The <input> tag
The <textarea> tag
When creating a Web form, which of the following should you use to create a scrolling text field into which users can enter multiple lines of text?
The <textarea> tag
The <form> tag
The <input> tag
The <select> tag

Consider the following HTML code:

<p>Are you CIW certified?</p>
<select name="Certified" size="4">
<option>Not yet</option>
<option>CIW Web Foundations Associate</option>
<option>CIW Web Design Professional</option>
<option>CIW Web Development Professional</option>
</select>


Which type of form field does this HTML code create?
A drop-down list from which users can choose one response
A drop-down list from which users can choose multiple responses
A group of radio buttons from which users can choose one response
A group of check boxes from which users can choose multiple responses
Which Web form field allows users to choose from among two or more mutually exclusive options?
Radio button
Check box
Select list
Text box
Which Web form field allows users to choose from among two or more non-exclusive options?
Check box
Radio button
Select list
Text box
Which Web form field should you use to create a scrolling text field into which a user can enter multiple lines of text?
Text area
Multiple-option select list
Text box
Single-option select list
Which attribute is shared by all Web form field elements?
The name attribute
The action attribute
The method attribute
The type attribute
The most common form field used in designing Web forms is the:
text box.
check box.
radio button.
text area.
For what should you use the value attribute when creating a text box field?
To place default text inside the text box
To specify the maximum number of characters a user can enter into the text box
To specify the minimum number of characters a user must enter into the text box
To specify the width of the text box in characters
When you create a text box field, you should use the size attribute to:
specify the visual width of the text box in characters.
specify the maximum number of characters a user can enter into the text box.
specify the minimum number of characters a user must enter into the text box.
specify the visual width of the text box in pixels.
When you create a text box field, you should use the maxlength attribute to:
specify the maximum number of characters a user can enter into the text box.
specify the visual width of the text box in pixels.
specify the visual width of the text box in characters.
specify the minimum number of characters a user must enter into the text box.

Consider the following HTML code:

<input type="file" name="File"/>

What does this code create on a Web form?
A Browse button so users can select and upload files to your site
A Find File button so users can specify files they want to download from your site
A Send File button so users can select and upload files to your site
A text box so users can specify files they want to find on your site
What occurs when a user clicks the Submit button on a Web form?
The data from all fields in the form is sent to be processed by the action specified in the <form> tag.
All form fields are cleared and the data is submitted.
All form fields are cleared and set back to their default settings.
A Choose File dialog box appears, which the user can use to navigate to and select a local file for uploading.
What occurs when a user clicks the Reset button on a Web form?
All form fields are cleared and set back to their default settings.
The data from all fields in the form is sent to be processed by the action specified in the <form> tag.
All form fields are cleared and the data is submitted.
A Choose File dialog box appears, which the user can use to navigate to and select a local file for uploading.
Radio buttons are reserved for two or more mutually exclusive options on a Web form. How do you ensure this exclusivity?
The radio buttons must share the same name attribute.
The radio buttons must share the same value attribute.
The radio buttons must share the same type attribute.
The radio buttons must share the same checked attribute.
Which choice correctly specifies the attribute and value needed in an <input> tag for a group of radio buttons to designate a preselected option?
The checked="checked" attribute and value
The checked="on" attribute and value
The checked="yes" attribute and value
The checked="select" attribute and value
By adding the checked="checked" attribute and value into the <input> tag for a group of check boxes, you can:
preselect as many check boxes as you like.
preselect only one check box in the group of check boxes.
specify that each check box be treated as part of a single database field.
specify that each check box be treated as a separate database field.
When you create a select list, how can you specify to pass a value different from the text that appears in the list?
Add the value="" attribute into any or all of the <option> tags.
Add the multiple="" attribute into any or all of the <option> tags.
Add the name="" attribute into any or all of the <option> tags.
Add the type="" attribute into any or all of the <option> tags.

Consider the following HTML code:

<select name="Countries" multiple="multiple" size="8">

What does the size attribute control?
The number of items that will appear in the scrolling list box
The maximum number of characters allowed for each item in the scrolling list box
The maximum number of items that can be offered in the scrolling list box
The width in characters of the scrolling list box
What happens if you omit the size attribute when you use the <select> tag to create a select list?
The number of items that will appear in the list by default will depend on the browser.
No more than four items will appear in the list.
No items will appear in the list.
The scrolling list box will appear as a blank box with an "X" in it.
If you want to specify default text for a text area box, where should you add the text that will appear as default text?
Between the <textarea> tags
To the name="" attribute of the <textarea> tag
To the value="" attribute of the <textarea> tag
To the type="" attribute of the <textarea> tag
Which of the following should you use to specify the width in characters of a scrolling text box?
The cols attribute
The maxlength attribute
The width attribute
The size attribute
Which of the following occurs when you specify the wrap="soft" attribute and value for the <textarea> tag?
Text you enter will continue on one line beyond the scrolling text box border.
Text you enter will wrap to the next row as it approaches the scrolling text box border.
The amount of text you will be able to type in each row will be restricted to the width of the scrolling text box.
You will be able to enter only one row of text in the scrolling text box.
Which HTML code will produce a Web-user form field that offers the user round buttons with mutually exclusive choices?
<input type="radio" name="Certifications" value="Associate"/> CIW Web Foundations Associate <input type="radio" name="Certifications" value="Professional"/> CIW Web Design Professional
<select name="Certifications"> <option>CIW Web Foundations Associate</option> <option>CIW Web Design Professional</option> </select>
<input type="checkbox" name="Certifications" value="Associate"/> CIW Web Foundations Associate <input type="checkbox" name="Certifications" value="Professional"/> CIW Web Design Professional
<select name="Certifications" multiple="multiple> <option>CIW Web Foundations Associate</option> <option>CIW Web Design Professional</option> </select>

Consider the following HTML code:

<form>
<p>Which skills can you offer a potential employer?</p>
<input type="checkbox" name="Skills" value="HTML"/> HTML coding
<input type="checkbox" name="Skills" value="GUI"/> GUI authoring tools
<input type="checkbox" name="Skills" value="Design"/> Fundamental Web design
<input type="checkbox" name="Skills" value="PMgmt"/> Project management
<input type="checkbox" name="Skills" value="EComm"/> E-commerce solutions
</form>


Which type of form field does this HTML code create?
A group of square buttons from which users can choose multiple responses
A group of round buttons from which users can choose one response
A list from which users can choose multiple responses
A list from which users can choose one response
Which of the following is a sensible method of reducing spam submissions to Web forms you create?
CAPTCHA
Search engine optimization (SEO)
Common Gateway Interface (CGI)
FormMail
If you are conducting search engine optimization (SEO), you should:
create as simple a form as possible.
create a complex form in order to slow a bot reading the page.
always use a CAPTCHA because it usually increases the search engine score.
use form fields without labels.
